titles.title: Social Security Trust Funds Restoration Act of 2006
Social Security Trust Funds Restoration Act of 2006
Social Security Trust Funds Restoration Act of 2006
Social Security Trust Funds Restoration Act of 2006
A bill to provide authority for restoration of the Social Security Trust Funds from the effects of a clerical error, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Senate Committee on Finance discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Thomas asked unanimous consent to take from the Speaker's table and consider.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Social Security Trust Funds Restoration Act of 2006 - Makes appropriations to the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Federal Disability Insurance Trust Fund to restore amounts erroneously overpaid from the Trust Funds to the general fund of the Treasury between 1999 and 2005 as transfers, under the voluntary withholding program, of anticipated taxes on benefit payments under title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act.
